metadata.title: CVE-2019-6472 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A packet containing a malformed DUID can cause the Kea DHCPv6 serverprocess (kea-dhcp6) to exit due to an assertion failure. Versions affected:1.4.0 to 1.5.0, 1.6.0-beta1, and 1.6.0-beta2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-6472` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

kea - 2.2.0-5ubuntu4
kea-admin - 2.2.0-5ubuntu4
kea-common - 2.2.0-5ubuntu4
kea-ctrl-agent - 2.2.0-5ubuntu4
kea-dhcp-ddns-server - 2.2.0-5ubuntu4
kea-dhcp4-server - 2.2.0-5ubuntu4
kea-dhcp6-server - 2.2.0-5ubuntu4
python3-kea-connector - 2.2.0-5ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: isc-kea package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.0-5ubuntu4').
